caption: 18 ; CNBOnTheMove OneHomeTeamOn 18 May 2022, ICA officers foiled an attempt to smuggle about 17,704g of heroin, 261g of Ice and 2g of Ecstasy tablets in an arriving Malaysia-registered car via the Woodlands Checkpoint. The driver was arrested. CNB officers mounted follow-up enforcement operations and arrested two other suspected male Malaysian drug offenders in Singapore over 18 and 19 May. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $1,295,000 and is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 8,430 heroin abusers and 150 Ice abusers for a week.Full story: (linkinbio)

caption: #: , $ - CNB recently concluded a 5-day island-wide operation to disrupt drug syndicates and target abusers.In one case, 20kg of cannabis and 6.2kg of heroin were seized. Two Singaporeans and a Malaysian man were arrested. Most of the drugs seized were uncovered at one of the traffickers' hideout in an apartment block in the vicinity of Braddell Hill.The operation also covered other locations including Ang Mo Kio, Bukit Batok and Yio Chu Kang. The total amount of drugs seized during this operation is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 2,960 heroin abusers, 410 'Ice' abusers and 2,910 cannabis abusers for a week.AC Leon Chan, Deputy Director of Central Narcotics Bureau (Operations), said:"Singapore's open economy and connectedness as a regional transport hub, and its proximity to major drug-producing regions, places it in constant danger of being overwhelmed by an influx of narcotics. While the drug situation in Singapore is relatively under control, we cannot take this for granted.This latest haul of drugs has disrupted the syndicates, and CNB will continue to keep up the pressure on them. We are also controlling local demand with our dragnet operations targeting drug abusers."Full story:

The total amount of drugs seized during this operation is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 2,960 heroin abusers, 410 'Ice' abusers, and 2,910 cannabis abusers for a week. Deputy Director of Central Narcotics Bureau (Operations) said: "Singapore's open economy and connectedness as a regional transport hub, and its proximity to major drug-producing regions, places it in constant danger of being overwhelmed by an influx of narcotics. While the drug situation in Singapore is relatively under control, we cannot take this for granted. This latest haul of drugs has disrupted the syndicates, and CNB will continue to keep up the pressure on them. caption: #: ; Over 4kg of suspected illicit drugs, including some which were found hidden in tampered milk tea sachets, were seized in a hotel room in the vicinity of Bras Basah Road during a recent CNB operation.In the evening of 9 May, CNB officers raided the hotel room and had to effect forced entry. A 31-year-old Singaporean man was arrested in the bathroom, where he was suspected to have been disposing of illicit drugs into the toilet bowl. Packets of cannabis, as well as other drugs, were recovered from the toilet bowl, cistern and drainage, as well as in other parts of the hotel room.A total of about 65g of Ice, 2,155g of cannabis, 5g of ketamine, 360g of Ecstasy tablets, multiple LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, 1,310g of Erimin-5 tablets and 700g of tampered sachets of beverage mix believed to contain controlled drugs were seized during the operation. The seizure of 2,155g of cannabis can feed the addiction of about 307 abusers.Superintendent Aaron Tang, Director of Intelligence Division, said:It is not surprising that drug trafficking syndicates have continued to exploit various novel drug concealment methods to evade CNBs persistent enforcement actions. In this operation, we saw how syndicates have tampered milk tea sachets to hide their drugs. CNB will spare no efforts in launching well-timed operations to prevent these drugs from contaminating our society. We will also carry out our duty to prevent unscrupulous offenders from enticing the unsuspecting public and youths to consume these drugs.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.Full story:

We will also carry out our duty to prevent unscrupulous offenders from enticing the unsuspecting public and youths to consume these drugs. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.

caption: #: . , On 26 April 2022, three Singaporean men aged between 20 and 22 were arrested for suspected drug activities by CNB officers. One of the men was escorted to a locked riser in the vicinity of Eunos Crescent, where, using a key found on him, officers unlocked the riser and recovered about 2,312g of heroin.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine), he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the suspects drug activities are ongoing.Full story:
cleaned_caption: On 26 April 2022, three Singaporean men aged between 20 and 22 were arrested for suspected drug activities by CNB officers. One of the men was escorted to a locked riser in the vicinity of Eunos Crescent, where, using a key found on him, officers unlocked the riser and recovered about 2,312g of heroin. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine), he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the suspects' drug activities are ongoing. Full story:

caption: #: , 60, . 735 254 In the afternoon of 22 April, CNB officers arrested a 61-year-old man in the vicinity of Serangoon Road. About 245g of Ice was recovered from him, along with cash amounting to close to $3,400. In a follow-up operation, two other men (aged 65 and 67), and a 65-year-old woman were arrested in the same vicinity. A total of about 521g of heroin, 3g of Ice and cash amounting to more than $1,500 were recovered from the 67-year-old man. The 65-year-old man and woman were escorted to their hideout in a private residential estate in the same vicinity, where about 214g of heroin, 6g of Ice and various drug paraphernalia were seized from the residential unit. Cash amounting to more than $12,000 were also recovered from the 65-year-old man. The seizure of 735g of heroin can feed the addiction of about 350 abusers for a week, and the seizure of 254g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 150 abusers. Under the Misuse of Drugs Act, if a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine) or 250g of methamphetamine, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story: (linkinbio)

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 32 - In an island-wide operation from 18 and 19 April 2022, CNB officers arrested 32 suspected drug offenders, The operation was targeted at drug transactions conducted through chat applications. Areas covered during this operation include Bukit Panjang, Compassvale, Jurong West and Sembawang.A total of about 191g of Ice, 718g of cannabis, 4g of ketamine, 4g of cocaine, 714g of Ecstasy tablets, multiple LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, 201 Erimin-5 tablets and two bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth about $140,000.In one of the cases, CNB officers arrested a 26-year-old man in the vicinity of Bukit Batok West on 18 April evening. The man was escorted to his residence in the same vicinity, where a total of about 173g of crystalline substances believed to contain Ice, 488g of cannabis, 713g of Ecstasy tablets and other drugs were seized. A 24-year-old man who later visited the same residential unit was also arrested for suspected drug offences. SUPT Stanley Seah, Deputy Director of CNBs Intelligence Division, said: CNB had carried out a similar operation in November last year, targeted at drug transactions conducted on encrypted chat applications where 50 suspected drug offenders were arrested. Drug offenders naively assume that these chat applications can afford them the anonymity to facilitate their illegal activities, so that they can evade CNBs detection but they are wrong.This latest operation shows that CNB is not letting up on our efforts against drug offenders, regardless of whichever methods they use to mask their activities.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full Story: (linkinbio)

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 84 - ; 231 , 304 ' In an island-wide operation from 10 to 14 April 2022, CNB officers arrested 84 suspected drug offenders across Singapore in areas including Hougang, Telok Blangah, and Yishun. A total of 231g of heroin, 304g of Ice, 36g of ketamine, 113 Ecstasy tablets, eight Erimin-5 tablets and 16 bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) were seized. These drugs have an estimated street value of more than $70,000. The youngest arrested is a 16-year-old male Singaporean for suspected drug abuse.In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 and arrested a 55-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking offences. Forced entry was effected as the man had refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers. A total of about 174g of heroin and 6g of Ice, along with various drug paraphernalia, were seized from the unit. On the same day, CNB conducted a follow-up operation to arrest the 55-year-olds drug clients. Two Singaporean men, aged 44 and 45, were subsequently arrested in the same vicinity.SUPT Mohd Hamzah Yusop, Director of Enforcement Division Sector 1, said of the island-wide operation: This island-wide operation is part of CNBs sustained commitment to keep our streets safe from the scourge of drugs. Our officers have been diligent in following up on all drug leads, and we will spare no effort to track down both drug traffickers and drug abusers.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full Story: (linkinbio)

Our officers have been diligent in following up on all drug leads, and we will spare no effort to track down both drug traffickers and drug abusers. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.

These drugs have an estimated street value of more than $70,000. The youngest arrested is a 16-year-old male Singaporean for suspected drug abuse. In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 and arrested a 55-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking offences. Forced entry was effected as the man had refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers. A total of about 174g of heroin and 6g of Ice, along with various drug paraphernalia, were seized from the unit. On the same day, CNB conducted a follow-up operation to arrest the 55-year-old's drug clients. Two Singaporean men, aged 44 and 45, were subsequently arrested in the same vicinity. The Director of Enforcement Division Sector 1 said of the island-wide operation: This island-wide operation is part of CNB's sustained commitment to keep our streets safe from the scourge of drugs. Our officers have been diligent in following up on all drug leads, and we will spare no effort to track down both drug traffickers and drug abusers. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.

caption: "I'm currently volunteering at a faith-based drug rehabilitation support movement for women. At 13, I started taking drugs because I felt rejected by my family. My health deteriorated and I ran into trouble with the law.The birth of my son and my journey with my faith turned my life around. Both helped me to accept, love and protect myself. Thereafter, my health was restored. My advice to others who are tempted to try drugs - Learn to recognise the potential obligations of peer pressure. Starting with e-cigarettes, alcohol abuse, it may escalate to pills. Never feel ashamed to seek help from trusted people."- Hannah Chun SingaporeansAgainstDrugs SGAD

caption: CNBOntheMove: 9 , 0.5 ; In the afternoon of 30 March, CNB officers arrested a Malaysian man in the vicinity of Beach Road, and about 4,876g of cannabis was recovered from him. The man was escorted to his residence where an addition of about 3,877g of cannabis and 463g of heroin were also seized.The total quantity of 8,753g of cannabis seized can feed the addiction of about 1,250 abusers for a week, while the 463g of heroin seized can feed the addiction of about 220 abusers for a week.Superintendent Aaron Tang, Director of Intelligence Division, said: The drug seizures in this operation serve as a reminder of our firm zero-tolerance approach towards drugs, including cannabis. Cannabis is an illicit drug in Singapore. It is addictive, and its use can produce several harmful effects, such as irreversible brain damage, brain volume reduction, and serious mental / psychiatric illnesses.Beyond their physical effects, illicit drugs exact a heavy price on our families and communities. Livelihoods are lost, relationships are destroyed, and families are broken.In order to protect our society from the harm of drugs, CNB will continue to enforce strict laws against the trafficking, possession, consumption and import or export of illicit drugs. CNB will also not let up on our enforcement efforts to arrest drug abusers who purchase drugs from syndicates.Investigations are ongoing.Full Story: (linkinbio)

caption: Join us on an exciting crash course on filmmaking on 23 April 2022! Learn the A-Zs of filming from story conceptualisation to post-production where you put everything together with the right editing techniques, music and effects! You will also have an opportunity speak with an experienced Narcotics Officer who will share about the most commonly abused drugs in Singapore and how not to fall prey to drug abuse. Register today at link in bio .drugfreeSG and we look forward to your participation!DrugFreeSGVideoCompetition SayNoToDrugs DrugFreeSG DaretoCare StrongerTogether

caption: CNBOntheMove: - ; , In an island-wide operation from 14 to 23 March, CNB arrested 100 suspected drug offenders across Singapore in areas including Choa Chu Kang, Macpherson, Seng Kang and Tampines. A total of about 279g of heroin, 404g of Ice, 6,308g of cannabis, 237g of ketamine, 2g of new psychoactive substances, more than 709g of Ecstasy tablets, 197 Erimin-5 tablets, 19 LSD stamps and 200ml of liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) were seized. These drugs have an estimated street value of about $382,000. The youngest arrested is a 16-year-old male Singaporean for suspected drug abuse.At one particular location in the vicinity of Jalan Damai, a 22-year-old man was arrested for suspected drug-related offences. About 3kg of cannabis was seized, along with other drugs, as well as several knives, a chopper and an airsoft gun which were found in his room. He was then brought to his official place of residence nearby where various drug paraphernalia and another airsoft gun were seized.AC Lim Fung Suan, Director of Enforcement Division Sector 2, said of the island-wide operation: CNB has worked tirelessly to stem the flow of drugs to keep Singapore safe. Our officers have put in a lot of hard work to bring drug offenders to justice, even amidst dangerous and unpredictable situations involving offenders who may turn violent against them. At CNB and the Home Team, we believe that drugs have no place in Singapore, and we are committed to keep our streets safe from drugs.Investigations are ongoing. Full Story: go.gov.sg/100suspectsarrested25mar2022 ( )

caption: : - . .In a follow-up operation on 16 March 2022, 11 suspected male drug abusers (comprising four Singaporeans and seven foreigners) were arrested. A total of about 280g of cocaine, 54g of cannabis and cannabis seeds, 33 Ecstasy tablets and 245g of brown powder suspected to contain controlled drugs were seized in the operations. Superintendent Aaron Tang, Director of Intelligence Division, said:Drug abuse is a persistent threat that targets every vulnerable segment of our society. It exacts a heavy price on abusers, their families and our community. This is why Singapore takes a zero-tolerance approach towards drugs to prevent harm to our people and society, and to create an environment where our children can live and play safely. Those who visit or live in Singapore must abide by our laws. If they choose to break them, they must be prepared to face the consequences. CNB will not hesitate to take action against these drug offenders and will keep up our enforcement efforts. Our message is clear - there is no place for drugs in our society.Investigations into the drug activities of all 14 arrested suspects are ongoing. CNBonthemove Full Story: go.gov.sg/300gcocainebooksmar22cnb ( )

caption: #: - ; , During the operations that took place on 4 and 5 March, 3 men (aged between 50 and 55), and a 29 year old woman were arrested. CNB seized a total of about 1,494g of heroin, 428g of Ice, 78g of cannabis, 326g of Ecstasy tablets, 303 Erimin-5 tablets and 3g of Yaba tablets. These drugs had a total estimated street value of $221,000.The 55 year old and 50 year old were caught when CNB officers intercepted the vehicles they were respectively driving near Chai Chee Street and North Canal Road on 4 March. In a followup ops the same evening, CNB officers raided a unit in the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Ave 3 and arrested a 54 year old man. A 29 year old woman was arrested in the vicinity of Jalan Eunos in the early hours of 5 March.Drug paraphernalia and weighing scales were also seized during the ops. Superintendent William Tan, Senior Assistant Director of CNBs Intelligence Division, said of the operation: The drugs seized from this operation can feed the addiction of about 1,000 abusers for a week. But the harm goes beyond this number. Illicit drugs are harmful and addictive, and the despicable actions of drug traffickers can destroy lives, families and communities... CNB will continue with our targeted operations against drug syndicates to prevent drugs from flowing into the streets. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine) or 250g of methamphetamine, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the suspects drug activities are ongoing.Read more here:

If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine) or 250g of methamphetamine, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the suspects' drug activities are ongoing.

caption: #: 93 - During the operations that took place from 27 Feb to 4 Mar, controlled drugs of more than 1kg of heroin, and others were seized. These drugs have an estimated street value of about $78,000.Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation included Bedok, Tampines and Toa Payoh.In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Circuit Road, and arrested two men aged 40 and 51 for suspected drug offences in the late evening of 27 Feb. As officers moved in to arrest the 51-year-old man, he put up a violent struggle and necessary force was used to subdue him. A knife was also later recovered from the 40-year-old man. About 3g of heroin and 2g of Ice were seized from the 51-year-old man. Another 946g of heroin and various drug paraphernalia were seized in another residential unit that the 51-year-old man was escorted to.In another case on 28 Feb in the vicinity of Clementi Ave 3, 8 persons were arrested including a 71-year-old man and his 49-year-old daughter. The father and daughter pair were arrested for suspected drug consumption. SUPT Mohd Hamzah Yusop, Director of Enforcement Division Sector 1, said of the island-wide ops : Drug offenders who think they can evade from the enforcement actions of CNB are mistaken. Our officers have worked hard during the week-long operation, and we will continue to launch timely and co-ordinated operations to keep our community safe and drug-free.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine), he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.Read more here:
cleaned_caption: During the operations that took place from 27 Feb to 4 Mar, controlled drugs of more than 1kg of heroin, and others were seized. These drugs have an estimated street value of about $78,000. Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation included Bedok, Tampines and Toa Payoh. In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Circuit Road and arrested two men for suspected drug offences in the late evening of 27 Feb. As officers moved in to arrest one of the men, he put up a violent struggle and necessary force was used to subdue him. A knife was also later recovered from the other man. About 3g of heroin and 2g of Ice were seized from the man who struggled. Another 946g of heroin and various drug paraphernalia were seized in another residential unit that he was escorted to. In another case on 28 Feb in the vicinity of Clementi Ave 3, 8 persons were arrested including a 71-year-old man and his 49-year-old daughter. The father and daughter pair were arrested for suspected drug consumption. SUPT Mohd Hamzah Yusop, Director of Enforcement Division Sector 1, said of the island-wide ops: Drug offenders who think they can evade from the enforcement actions of CNB are mistaken. Our officers have worked hard during the week-long operation, and we will continue to launch timely and co-ordinated operations to keep our community safe and drug-free. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine), he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.

generated_caption: The image features a creative design concept for an "Anti-drug hand sanitiser activity." Central to the design is a large hand sanitiser bottle, depicted with a clear body and a prominent teal ribbon symbolizing the anti-drug movement. Surrounding the sanitiser are various colorful stickers, including cartoon characters, fruits, and encouraging messages such as "stay safe, stay drug-free!" and "Design your own anti-drug hand sanitiser!" The visual promotes drug awareness initiatives held in Singapore, such as those led by youth groups. The activity encourages parent-child interaction through creativity while advocating for a drug-free lifestyle. No people can be seen in the image, focusing solely on the design elements and messages.

caption: Meet CNB officer SSI Che Yahya Bin Mohd Bujang and his fellow (DIH) colleagues! SSI Yahya joined CNB in 1987. Over the last 35 years, he has chalked up a wealth of experience in the Enforcement, Supervision and Intelligence Divisions of CNB.He was also part of the pioneering team at CNBs Community Engagement Unit. SSI Yahya was closely involved in the launch of the DIH campaign in 2017. Together with other CNB officers and the community, they travelled around to rally the community, going the extra mile to support DIH volunteers in spreading the anti-drug message. Despite restrictions brought about by Covid-19, his team persevered with online sessions to sustain the engagement. For his significant contributions, commitment and dedication, SSI Yahya received the Efficiency Medal at the recent National Day Investiture held for MHA officers. Congratulations, SSI Yahya!SingaporeansAgainstDrugs SGAD DrugFreeSG DadahItuHaram

cleaned_caption: Meet CNB officer SSI and his fellow DIH colleagues! SSI joined CNB in 1987. Over the last 35 years, he has chalked up a wealth of experience in the Enforcement, Supervision, and Intelligence Divisions of CNB. Together with other CNB officers and the community, they travelled around to rally the community, going the extra mile to support DIH volunteers in spreading the anti-drug message. Despite restrictions brought about by Covid-19, his team persevered with online sessions to sustain the engagement. caption: #: , $ , . On 25 February 2022, CNB officers raided a residential unit in a private residential enclave in the vicinity of Upper Serangoon Road and arrested three men for suspected drug activities. Large quantities of cannabis, Ice, heroin, cocaine and other drugs with a total estimated street value of $726,000 were found in the unit. Investigations into the suspects drug activities, including an investigation into their financial activities to trace and forfeit proceeds and property from the drug activities, are ongoing.AC Leon Chan, Deputy Director of Central Narcotics Bureau (Operations), said of the operation:Drug syndicates and traffickers are motivated by greed and will capitalise on the addiction and misery of drug abusers for profit. To them, drug abusers are revenue streams to cultivate and exploit, and they do not care that their actions are at the expense of innocent others such as the children or loved ones of the drug abusers. My officers remain committed to the mission of keeping Singapore drug-free, and will continue to clamp down on these illicit drug activities.Full News Release:

caption: "To be an MVP on and off the field, stay clear of drugs.Last Saturday, SINDA FC (Singapore Indian Development Association) held a football training session for youths together with CNB officers, and there was also a candid dialogue with participants on the drug situation in Singapore. Our officers also shared their personal and work experiences with the youths, highlighting the importance of maintaining a healthy and drug-free lifestyle. This collaboration was part of CNBs community outreach efforts under the Bothaiporulai Ethirthu Nirpom (BEN) campaign.*The BEN or Bothaiporulai Ethirthu Nirpom (We Stand United Against Drugs) campaign is one of CNBs Preventive Drug Education community outreach efforts. BEN seeks to spread the anti-drug message to the Indian community. This is done through face-to-face engagement with people, as well as in partnership with volunteers, community groups and media personalities who warmly step forward.: the BEN teamSingaporeansAgainstDrugs SGAD DrugFreeSG BEN BothaiporulaiEthirthuNirpomWeStandUnitedAgainstDrugs
cleaned_caption: "To be an MVP on and off the field, stay clear of drugs. Last Saturday, SINDA FC (Singapore Indian Development Association) held a football training session for youths together with CNB officers, and there was also a candid dialogue with participants on the drug situation in Singapore. Our officers also shared their personal and work experiences with the youths, highlighting the importance of maintaining a healthy and drug-free lifestyle. This collaboration was part of CNB's community outreach efforts under the Bothaiporulai Ethirthu Nirpom (BEN) campaign. The BEN or Bothaiporulai Ethirthu Nirpom (We Stand United Against Drugs) campaign is one of CNB's Preventive Drug Education community outreach efforts. BEN seeks to spread the anti-drug message to the Indian community. This is done through face-to-face engagement with people, as well as in partnership with volunteers, community groups and media personalities who warmly step forward."
generated_caption: Last Saturday, SINDA FC (Singapore Indian Development Association) conducted a dynamic football training session for youths, collaborating with officers from the Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) under the Bothaiporulai Ethirthu Nirpom (BEN) campaign. Participants engaged in candid dialogues about the drug situation in Singapore, emphasizing the importance of maintaining a healthy, drug-free lifestyle. The session took place on a vibrant artificial turf field, where attendees received not only football skills training but also valuable life lessons. This initiative aims to spread the anti-drug message within the Indian community, fostering resilience and teamwork among the youths. No external distractions are visible, focusing attention on the mentor-mentee interactions.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ; -- Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) officers arrested three men for suspected drug activities on 21 February 2022. A total of about 5,268g of cannabis and 11g of Ice, with a total estimated street value of $160,000, were seized during the operation. The seizure of 5,268g of cannabis can feed the addiction of about 750 abusers for a week.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Full story: go.gov.sg/three-men-arrested-more-than-5kg-of-cannabis-seized

caption: CNBOnTheMove: The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) seized nearly $700,000 worth of e-vaporisers and components found during a CNB anti-drug operation on 16 February 2022. caption: [ ] Amidst a challenging global and regional drug situation, Singapore remains steadfast in adopting a comprehensive drug control strategy for a DrugFreeSG. This is done through preventive drug education, tough anti-drug laws, rigorous enforcement, international engagement, and rehabilitation and aftercare of drug offenders. While the number of drug abusers arrested in 2021 decreased by 11%, the proportion of new drug abusers and young drug abusers arrested remained significant. The international drug scene remains of concern too, and Singapore is located at the doorstep of the worlds largest drug producing region. Amid COVID-19 travel restrictions, drug trafficking syndicates continued to look for novel ways to bring drugs into Singapore. Nonetheless, drug seizures remained high in 2021 and are indicative of CNBs effective enforcement efforts. In 2021, CNB dismantled 25 drug syndicates. CNB also worked closely with the Home Team agencies to conduct more than 100 joint operations, including at the checkpoints, to intercept attempts to smuggle drugs into Singapore. COVID-19 did not put a stop to CNBs preventive drug education efforts. The fundamental principle underlying Singapores approach against drugs is to prevent harm to our people and society in the first place. This is much more effective than letting the drug problem grow and fester. Singapore takes a zero-tolerance stand against drugs because it is the best approach for Singapore, and it has helped keep the drug situation under control. Drug abuse can exact a heavy price on abusers, their family, and ultimately society, and the focus hence has to be on building a drug-free society, not a drug-tolerant one. CNB will continue to work closely with the community, and keep up our efforts to prevent drug abuse. Lets work together to keep Singapore DrugFree for future generations! Read the full statistics release here: go.gov.sg/cnb-annual-statistics-2021Highlights of CNBs Preventive Drug Education efforts in 2021 can be found here: go.gov.sg/cnb-annual-statistics-2021-annex

caption: #: , On 28 and 29 Janurary 2022, a total of about 3.8kg of Ice, 1.8kg of cannabis, as well as Ecstasy tablets and other illicit drugs with a total estimated street value of $768,000 were seized during a CNB operation. Three men aged 38, 48 and 58 were arrested.A suspected drug store in an industrial building, where drugs were hidden in packages of coffee beans, was also uncovered. Large quantites of drugs were also found in the residence of one of the suspects.Drug producers in the region are producing more drugs. Those intending to import and traffic these illegal drugs here into Singapore and intending to bring harm to our community will be dealt with by the law. My officers will be thorough in bringing those involved in this case to justice. - AC Leon Chan, Deputy Director of CNB The seizure of 3,862g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 2,210 abusers for a week, while 1,873g of cannabis is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 270 abusers for a week.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing. cleaned_caption: On 28 and 29 January 2022, a total of about 3.8kg of Ice, 1.8kg of cannabis, as well as Ecstasy tablets and other illicit drugs with a total estimated street value of $768,000 were seized during a CNB operation. My officers will be thorough in bringing those involved in this case to justice. The seizure of 3,862g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 2,210 abusers for a week, while 1,873g of cannabis is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 270 abusers for a week. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.

caption: #: - On 20 Jan 2022, ICA officers foiled an attempt to smuggle about 7g of cannabis and cannabis products in a parcel declared to be cosmetic products. The products were sweets believed to have been infused with cannabis, and vaporisers containing cannabis extracts. CNB officers conducted a follow-up operation the same day and a 24-year-old Singaporean woman was arrested in the vicinity of Upper East Coast Road for suspected drug-related offences. 24 LSD stamps and two vaporisers containing cannabis extracts were further seized. Investigations are ongoing. Cannabis is a Class A controlled drug listed under Singapores Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA) in Singapore. The consumption, possession, trafficking, import or export of any controlled drugs, including cannabis and cannabis products, is an offence under the MDA. CNB would like to urge parents to play an active part to protect our youths from the menace of drugs, and to remind their children that they should not consume products unknown to them or offered by strangers. To entice youths to consume these products and to become addicted to them, these products are often disguised or marketed as candy or other food products, and sold in bright packaging designed to appeal to children and youths. Members of the public are advised to contact the CNB hotline at 1800-325-6666 for advice and assistance if they come across such illicit food products, or are worried that their children may be involved with drugs. Those who have drug-related information can make a report to CNB by calling 1800-325-6666 or at more:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- - In a 3-day island-wide drug operation from 8 to 10 December 2021, CNB arrested 63 suspected drug offenders. The youngest arrested is a 17-year-old male Singaporean suspected drug abuser. The total drugs seized are about 209g of heroin, 299g of Ice, 733g of cannabis, 10g of ketamine, 9g of NPS, one LSD stamp, one Erimin-5 tablet, and two bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB. The drugs have an estimated street value of more than $70,500.During the search in the drug raid around the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Street 22, CNB seized 12 packets and 107 straws containing 195g of heroin (see Photo). DrugFreeSG Read more here:
cleaned_caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- - In a 3-day island-wide drug operation from 8 to 10 December 2021, CNB arrested 63 suspected drug offenders. The drugs have an estimated street value of more than $70,500. During the search in the drug raid around the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Street 22, CNB seized 12 packets and 107 straws containing 195g of heroin (see Photo). DrugFreeSG Read more here:

caption: -? - Chat apps like Telegram are fun ways to connect with lots of people. But drug syndicates and suppliers have been using such platforms to seek out new clients and reconnect with existing ones, thinking such apps will allow them to evade the law. This time, 50 suspected drug offenders have been arrested, including a 20-year old Singaporean male. Investigations are ongoing. This is a reminder that we've been watching and taking action. Just stay away from drugs. Full Story here: DrugFreeSG

caption: 2 , 39 A 39-year-old Singaporean woman was arrested for suspected drug activities on the evening of 23 November 2021. A total of about more than 2kg of ketamine, 479g of heroin, 546g of Ice, and five strips of Subutex, with an estimated street value of $268,000, were seized during the operation. The seizure of 479g of heroin can feed the addiction of about 230 abusers for a week, while 546g of Ice is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 310 abusers for a week.CNBs investigations into the suspected drug offences are ongoing.CNBOntheMoveFull Media Statement:
cleaned_caption: 39 A 39-year-old Singaporean woman was arrested for suspected drug activities on the evening of 23 November 2021. A total of about more than 2kg of ketamine, 479g of heroin, 546g of Ice, and five strips of Subutex, with an estimated street value of $268,000, were seized during the operation. The seizure of 479g of heroin can feed the addiction of about 230 abusers for a week, while 546g of Ice is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 310 abusers for a week. CNB's investigations into the suspected drug offences are ongoing. CNB On the Move Full Media Statement:

caption: ' : ; - Acting on information provided by CNB, the Narcotics Crime Investigation Department (NCID) of the Royal Malaysian Police (RMP) arrested five Malaysians for suspected drug trafficking activities in and around Kuala Lumpur and Selangor. The drugs had an estimated street value of RM 4.9 million. Monitored by CNB since July 2021, the Malaysian-based syndicate was believed to have been trafficking drugs using Singapore-based freight forwarding companies, as legitimate forwarding agents, to deliver parcels which contain concealed drugs to other countries through Singapore. The swift arrest was the result of the strong collaboration between CNB & NCID, RMP. CNB will continue to maintain close international cooperation with law enforcement agencies for a DrugFreeSG. CNBOntheMove Full Media Statement: go.gov.sg/cnb-ncid-oct2021IntheNews: Press Conference: ,

caption: . ; In the latest drug bust by CNB on 25 and 26 Sep 2021 in multiple locations of Singapore, a total of about 4,342g of heroin, 191g of Ice, 15g of cannabis, 207g of Ecstasy tablets, 142 Erimin-5 tablets, and ten LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $328,000. The 4,342g of heroin seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 2,070 abusers for a week. Investigations are ongoing. CNBOntheMove DrugFreeSGFull Story here:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: Two 22-year-olds among 6 arrested for suspected drug trafficking activitiesIn two drug busts on 7 Sep 2021 in different parts of Singapore, four males aged between 22 and 55 and two females aged 22 and 35 were arrested for suspected drug-related activities.A total of about 2,804g of heroin, 109g of Ice, 225g of cannabis, 212 Ecstasy tablets and fragments, and five Erimin-5 tablets were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $222,000. The total amount of 2,804g of heroin seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 1,335 abusers for a week.Full Story:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: , , In a two-week island-wide operation from 16 to 27 Aug 2021, 161 suspected drug offenders were arrested at areas including Lakeside, Potong Pasir, Seng Kang, Teck Whye and Woodlands. The youngest arrested was a 17 year-old Singaporean female suspected of drug abuse.Drugs estimated worth more than $253,000 were seized with a total of about 3,069g of heroin, 544g of Ice, 53g of cannabis, 37g of ketamine, 31 Ecstasy tablets, 116 Erimin-5 tablets, and 11 bottles of methadone.Full Story:

caption: IntheNews: . Drugs hidden in buttons? As reported in Lianhe Wanbao (19 Aug), Tokyo Metropolitan police arrested three individuals who attempted to smuggle 2.6 kg of drugs, estimated to be worth $1.88 mil, with 1331 buttons. Each button held about 2g of drugs and were sewn onto 73 pieces of clothing. The clothing were shipped from the UK to Tokyo in the first half of August.Indeed, drug syndicates will try ways and means to traffic drugs, to profit off addiction. Our officers will remain alert and vigilant to ensure that our streets remain drugfree.

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE- 12 arrested during CNB Anti-Drug Operations; Drugs seized estimated to be worth more than $152,000In the latest drug bust on 3 and 4 August 2021, a total of about 624g of Ice, 2,375g of cannabis, 53g of ketamine, 413 Ecstasy tablets and fragments, 602 Erimin-5 tablets, 226 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, 161g of substances believed to be controlled drugs, and 116 bottles containing liquid believed to be laced with controlled drugs were seized in multiple locations in Singapore. This is CNBs second anti-drug operation targeted at drug syndicates in a week eight suspected drug offenders were previously arrested on 27 July 2021, which saw the total seizure of close to $749,000 worth of controlled drugs.The total amount of Ice and cannabis seized from both the 27 July, and 3 and 4 August operations are sufficient to feed the addiction of more than 2,150 abusers for a week.Investigations are ongoing. Read more:

caption: BAKING TROUBLE YET AGAIN - 42 baked goods and crumbs believed to be infused with cannabis seized, along with other drugs CNBONTHEMOVE In the latest drug busts that took place in multiple locations in Singapore on 27 July, CNB officers seized a total of about 42 baked goods and crumbs believed to be infused with cannabis, 2.5kg of Ice, 164g of cannabis, 7g of ketamine, 54 Ecstasy tablets, 9,831 Erimin-5 tablets, 5 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and 111 packets containing substances believed to be controlled drugs. Various drug paraphernalia were also recovered in one of the operations.A total of 5 males and 3 females were arrested for suspected drug-related activities.Investigations are ongoing.Read more here:
cleaned_caption: BAKING TROUBLE YET AGAIN - 42 baked goods and crumbs believed to be infused with cannabis seized, along with other drugs. In the latest drug busts that took place in multiple locations in Singapore on 27 July, officers seized a total of about 42 baked goods and crumbs believed to be infused with cannabis, 2.5kg of Ice, 164g of cannabis, 7g of ketamine, 54 Ecstasy tablets, 9,831 Erimin-5 tablets, 5 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and 111 packets containing substances believed to be controlled drugs. Various drug paraphernalia were also recovered in one of the operations. A total of 5 males and 3 females were arrested for suspected drug-related activities. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: - - -- - CNBONTHEMOVEIn an island-wide operation from 12 to 16 Jul 2021, CNB officers arrested 104 suspected drug offenders and seized a total of about 1.8kg of 'Ice', 535g of Ecstasy' tablets, 191g of heroin, 5g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS) and 6 Ecstasy tablets. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $198,000. Three very young children were also found during the operations and in close proximity to where suspected illegal drug consumption or activities had taken placed. Their welfare was taken care of and they have been placed in the safe custody of their next-of-kin.One of them was a 10-month-old baby. An officer who was at the scene (pictured) had this to say - "As a father to two daughters, I instinctively knew that the baby needed to drink milk when I saw her crying. It saddens me to see such innocent victims being brought up in such an environment. This is the reason why CNB officers are motivated to give our best in our work"News release:

caption: It is a fine sunny day until you stumble upon a cave in the woods, leading to 3 different entrances. There are different drugs lying before you, but what awaits behind their tempting facade is a rabbit hole of irreversible danger. Will you fall down that spiral? CNB has collaborated with the Singapore Press Holdings to develop a new interactive gamification, Down the Rabbit Hole. Find out more about the harmful effects of different drugs now at Make the right choice. Dont fall down the rabbit hole.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: CLOSE TO 1KG OF HEROIN SEIZED IN CNB OPERATIONIn the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 5 July 2021, a total of about 974g of heroin, 3g of cannabis, and 60g of suspected New Psychoactive Substances (NPS) were seized. Cash amounting to $57,929 and 330 nitrazepam tablets were also recovered during the operation. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $102,000. The total amount of 974g of heroin seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 460 abusers for a week. Two Singaporean suspected drug offenders, comprising of a 65-year-old male and a 55-year-old female, were arrested.Investigations are ongoing. Read more:

caption: Happy Youth Day to all youths (and the young at heart)! DidYouKnowPlay helps children work through stress and worries. Play benefits physical and mental health, and it helps maintain some normality in difficult times.Studies suggest that children who lack emotional support and endure stressful situations are more likely to experience toxic stress, which is associated with mental health problems, substance abuse and low amounts of play. ListenFirst DrugFreeSG ParentingTipsHow are you celebrating Youth Day?

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE - MORE THAN 10KG OF CONTROLLED DRUGS SEIZED; FOUR ARRESTED FOR SUSPECTED DRUG ACTIVITIES In the latest drug busts by Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) officers on 30 June 2021, a total of about 7,959g of heroin, 2,159g of Ice, 423g of cannabis, 202g of ketamine, about 1,451 Ecstasy tablets and about 300 Erimin-5 tablets were seized during the operation that took place in multiple locations in Singapore. cleaned_caption: CNBONTHEMOVE - STOP BAKING TROUBLE! In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 22 Jun, a total of about 3.2kg of cannabis, 14g of 'Ice', 9g of cocaine, 79 'Ecstasy' tablets, one Erimin-5 tablet, 108 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and 51 pieces of baked goods and butter believed to be infused with cannabis were seized from a residential unit in the vicinity of Siglap Walk, along with cash amounting to $4,100. caption: DidYouKnowFamily rules are a set of principles laying out what behaviour is expected of the family members. When applied lovingly and correctly, these rules can help the whole family get along.Research shows that parents who are loving and supportive but expect compliance with rules, and are both consistent and fair in their discipline, have more well-adjusted and resilient children. On the flipside, a lack of structure and insufficient limit-setting can put children at greater risk of problem behaviours (including drug/substance abuse). ListenFirst DrugFreeSG ParentingTips

caption: Check out these behind-the-scenes photos of the creators of the VR mobile game app - students from . Hear what inspired them to develop Man in the Mirror and contribute to the drug-free cause! The team wanted something different from existing efforts. We wanted to see if we could build a game that would help players empathise with the vulnerability of falling into substance abuse and addiction, with the aid of VR technology. However, all this would not have been possible without the story. While crafting the story, the team had many discussions on what we should focus on, be it pre- or post-abuse. We also considered the perspectives of abusers. Ultimately, we want to convey to our audience that prevention is better than cure, and inspire a sense of hope for those who wish to break free from addiction. ICYMI: The giveaway contest on Facebook is still ongoing till 4 June 2021! Like, comment a screenshot of the Man in the Mirror on your mobile devices, and hashtag DrugFreeSG for a chance to win a customised VR cardboard headset!

caption: CNBOnTheMove: OVER 10KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; 2 SUSPECTS ARRESTED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 25 May, a total of about 5.6KG of heroin, 2.5KG of Ice, 2.5KG of cannabis, 192 Ecstasy tablets, and seven Erimin-5 tablets were seized. Cash amounting to $28,000 and 703 nitrazepam tablets were also recovered during the operation, which took place in the vicinity of Fernvale Road. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $944,000. Two Singaporeans a 45-year-old male and a 31-year-old female, were arrested for suspected drug activities. Prior to the raid, two children, an 11-year-old boy and 10-year-old girl, were playing outside the unit. They were later established to be the children of the 31-year-old female suspect. Arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of the children were taken care of. The children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.Children are the unfortunate victims in many of such drug offences. Drug traffickers not only destroy the lives of others through their selfish and nefarious acts, but also bring pain and misery to their family and children. Parents play a key role in nurturing and guiding their children, and to keep them out of harms way. CNB endeavours to keeping the streets of Singapore safe from drugs through our rigorous enforcement actions and will continue to reach out to parents and work with them to guide their children towards a healthy, drug-free lifestyle. Mr Sebastian Tan, Deputy Director CNB (Operations)Investigations are ongoing.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: OVER 7KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; SEVEN SUSPECTS ARRESTEDOn 18 May, CNB officers conducted two operations which saw the seizure of a total of about 5KG of Ice, 2.2KG of heroin, 6g of cannabis, 1g of ketamine, more than 630g of Ecstasy tablets, 201 Erimin-5 tablets, and one LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamp, along with cash amounting to $4,585. Seven suspected drug offenders, comprising six males and one female aged between 26 and 48, were arrested. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $850,000. The operations took place at multiple locations, including in the vicinity of Jurong East Ave 1, Chai Chee Street and Lorong Limau. Investigations are ongoing. Photo 1 (CNB): Illicit drugs, including Ice and Ecstasy tablets, recovered from a safe in the vicinity of Lorong Limau on 18 May 2021.Photo 2 (CNB): About 466g of heroin, which was concealed inside a fire extinguisher, seized from a residential unit in the vicinity of Jurong East Ave 1 on 18 May 2021.

The operations took place at multiple locations, including in the vicinity of Jurong East Ave 1, Chai Chee Street and Lorong Limau. Investigations are ongoing. Photo 1 (CNB): Illicit drugs, including Ice and Ecstasy tablets, recovered from a safe in the vicinity of Lorong Limau on 18 May 2021.Photo 2 (CNB): About 466g of heroin, which was concealed inside a fire extinguisher, seized from a residential unit in the vicinity of Jurong East Ave 1 on 18 May 2021.

caption: DidYouKnowActive listening is when a caregiver listens to their child with the intent to listen and not to jump in and respond. Active listening is important during times of stress and can reduce fear and anxieties. Children who receive attention (especially at an early age) grow more confident, less anxious, and are likely to achieve better health, relationships and education. ListenFirst DrugFreeSG ParentingTips

caption: CNB STATEMENT ON ONLINE VIDEO CLIP OF SUBJECT ALLEGEDLY ABUSING DRUGSThe Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) is aware of a video clip circulating online of a female subject allegedly consuming drugs using an apparatus. CNB has identified the subject, and she is currently assisting in investigations. She has been released on bail into the custody of her parents. As investigations are ongoing, the public is advised not to circulate the video. Everyone, including parents and the community, has a role to play in protecting our youths from the harms of drugs. More information and useful toolkits on how to spot warning signs of potential drug problems, as well as how to effectively engage young people to stay drug-free can be found on the CNB website ( Parents can contact the CNB hotline at 1800-325-6666 for advice and assistance if you suspect or are worried that your children may be involved with drugs. Members of the public who have drug-related information can make a report to CNB by calling 1800-325-6666 or at

caption: LATEST: 15-YEAR-OLD AMONG 92 SUSPECTS ARRESTED FOR DRUG OFFENCES In the latest island-wide operation conducted by CNB from 4 to 9 Apr, a total of about 129g of heroin, 49g of Ice, 2g of cannabis, 52g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 1g of ketamine, 17 Ecstasy tablets, 30 Erimin-5 tablets, and eight LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $15,000. A total of 92 suspected drug offenders were arrested, and the youngest arrested in this island-wide operation is a 15-year-old Singaporean female suspected drug abuser. Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation include Ang Mo Kio, Bedok, Jurong and Punggol. Photo: Improvised lighters and heroin seized from a 43-year-old Singaporean females vehicle in the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Ave 4 on 5 April 2021. CNBOnTheMove

caption: The United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) Youth Forum is an annual event organised by the in the broader context of the Commission on Narcotic Drugs.This year, over 62 youth participants from around the world will gather virtually from 29 March to 2 April to learn more about different national drug control approaches, exchange views on how to better protect the health and well-being of their peers, and develop a joint statement to be delivered to global policy-makers.CNBs Anti-Drug Advocate Lim Zi Fei was selected to represent Singapore at the UNODC Youth Forum 2021.Participating in the UNODC Youth Forum is one of the greatest learning moments in my life. I am given the opportunity to connect and work with other youth participants from all over the world and contribute to the greater good of drug use prevention. - Lim Zi FeiIf you are passionate about the anti-drug cause and interested in such opportunities as well, join us as an Anti-Drug Advocate! Link in bio!

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: 2KG OF CANNABIS SEIZEDIn the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 29 Mar, a total of one bundle containing about 323g of 'Ice' and two bundles containing about 2kg of cannabis were recovered from within a blue plastic bag in the operation. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $72,000. The total amount of 323g of 'Ice' that had been seized in the operation is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 184 abusers for a week, while the total amount of 2kg of cannabis that had been seized in the operation is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 285 abusers for a week.One Singaporean male was arrested for suspected drug activities.Investigations are ongoing.

caption: Thats right, black tar heroin is a thing. Its formed by a crude industrial process, making this version of heroin much more toxic, and putting you at increased risk of life-threatening bacterial infections. And no, smoking and snorting heroin is NOT any less harmful than any other methods of heroin abuse. Here are some other facts about heroin that you might not have known!DrugFreeSG

caption: CNBOnTheMove: MORE THAN 35KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; DRUGS SUFFICIENT TO FEED MORE THAN 10,000 ABUSERS FOR A WEEK In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 16 and 17 Mar, three Singaporean males, aged between 27 and 33, were arrested for suspected drug-related offences. In total, over 35kg of illicit drugs were seized - including about 20.5kg of cannabis, 8.3kg of heroin, 6.4kg of Ice, about 1,091 Ecstasy tablets and 1,000 Erimin-5 tablets. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $1.7 million. Investigations are ongoing. The total amount of drugs seized in the operation is sufficient to feed 3,950 heroin abusers, 3,700 Ice abusers and 2,930 cannabis abusers for a week. At CNB and the Home Team, we believe that drugs have no place in Singapore and we are committed to keep our streets safe from drugs.
cleaned_caption: CNBOnTheMove: MORE THAN 35KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; DRUGS SUFFICIENT TO FEED MORE THAN 10,000 ABUSERS FOR A WEEK In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 16 and 17 Mar, three Singaporean males were arrested for suspected drug-related offences. In total, over 35kg of illicit drugs were seized - including about 20.5kg of cannabis, 8.3kg of heroin, 6.4kg of Ice, about 1,091 Ecstasy tablets and 1,000 Erimin-5 tablets. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $1.7 million. Investigations are ongoing. caption: 200 VIALS OF FENTANYL SEIZED, 3 ARRESTED BY CNBOn 1 March, ICA officers from Changi Airfreight Centre, Air Cargo Command noticed anomalies in the scanned images of a parcel declared as medicine from Vietnam. 200 vials believed to contain about 20mg of fentanyl were uncovered. Other illicit medicines were also found in the parcel. CNBOnTheMove: This detection prompted a follow-up operation by CNB officers, and the intended recipient of the parcel, a 30-year-old female Singapore Permanent Resident, was arrested in the vicinity of Beach Road. Two other Singaporean males (aged 62 and 25) were also arrested for suspected drug-related offences. The three suspects were escorted to their hideout, an apartment in the same vicinity. During a search of the apartment, other illicit medicines were found from within and HSA was alerted. Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. DidYouKnow: Fentanyl is known to be a very potent opioid, approximately 50-100 times more potent than morphine. The abuse of fentanyl results in similar effects to other opioids, such as nausea, drowsiness, respiratory depression, low blood pressure and slow heart rate. Due to its potency, fentanyl abuse brings with it a heightened risk of death as a result of overdosing and there have been many cases in overseas jurisdictions of overdose deaths relating to fentanyl and its derivatives.CNB would like to remind the public that fentanyl and its derivatives are listed as Class A controlled drugs under Singapores Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA). The possession, consumption, importation or trafficking of any controlled drug is an offence under the MDA.

The possession, consumption, importation, or trafficking of any controlled drug is an offence under the MDA.

caption: 2 MARCH DRAMA: 8 ARRESTED FOR SUSPECTED DRUG ACTIVITIES In the latest CNB operation on 2 March 2021, seven Singaporeans and one Malaysian (aged between 20 to 71) were arrested for suspected drug activities. A total of about 2kg of Ice, 928g of cannabis, 51g of heroin, 1g of cocaine, more than 4,000 Ecstasy tablets, and 106 Erimin-5 tablets were seized, along with cash amounting to $3,000. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth over $326,000. The arrests took place in the vicinity of Jalan Bukit Merah and Sumang Walk. During the raid of a residential unit around Jalan Bukit Merah, one of suspects, a 32-year-old Malaysian male, attempted to evade arrest by scaling out of the window of the unit located on the second storey. In the process, he fell and suffered injuries. He was conveyed conscious to the Singapore General Hospital for medical attention. He is currently in stable condition. Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. CNBOnTheMove
cleaned_caption: 2 MARCH DRAMA: 8 ARRESTED FOR SUSPECTED DRUG ACTIVITIES In the latest CNB operation on 2 March 2021, seven Singaporeans and one Malaysian (aged between 20 to 71) were arrested for suspected drug activities. A total of about 2kg of Ice, 928g of cannabis, 51g of heroin, 1g of cocaine, more than 4,000 Ecstasy tablets, and 106 Erimin-5 tablets were seized, along with cash amounting to $3,000. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth over $326,000. The arrests took place in the vicinity of Jalan Bukit Merah and Sumang Walk. During the raid of a residential unit around Jalan Bukit Merah, one of the suspects attempted to evade arrest by scaling out of the window of the unit located on the second storey. In the process, he fell and suffered injuries. He was conveyed conscious to the Singapore General Hospital for medical attention. He is currently in stable condition. Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. CNBOnTheMove

caption: CNB officers were among the 26,218 Home Team frontliners who have received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccination since the Home Team vaccination exercise started on 11 Jan 2021. Many of our officers have also received their second dose, and will be adequately protected against COVID-19 upon completing the full two-week vaccination regime.This is a strong testament to CNB's commitment in supporting the national fight against COVID-19. Being at the frontline to keep Singapore safe from the harms of drugs, it is important to protect ourselves against COVID-19 so that we can continue to carry out our duties effectively, and give our loved ones greater peace of mind when we are hard at work. SGUnited SGTogether DrugFreeSG

caption: CNB conducted a virtual learning journey yesterday for Youth Advisory Group (YAG). At the session, we shared about the local drug situation and Singapores drug control approach, and gathered perspectives on the role that youths can play to advocate for a drug-free Singapore. Two of our Anti-Drug Advocates attended the session too! To find out how you can join youthvoices in advocating for a DrugFreeSG, do visit: DidYouKnow The YAG is a diverse group of youths appointed under the ambit of the National Committee on Prevention, Rehabilitation and Recidivism (NCPR). They provide youth perspectives to the work of the NCPR that is aimed at addressing issues such as juvenile delinquency (e.g. drug abuse).

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: MORE THAN 3KG OF HEROIN AND 3,000 ECSTASY TABLETS SEIZED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 25 and 26 Feb 2021, a total of 3,036g of heroin, 1,510g of 'Ice', 993g of cannabis, 7g of ketamine, more than 3,000 'Ecstasy' tablets and capsules, 15 Erimin-5 tablets, and a bottle of methadone were seized. Cash amounting to $47,879 was also recovered during the operation, which took place in multiple locations. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $480,000. In one of the cases, CNB officers arrested a 35-year-old Singaporean male for suspected drug trafficking offences in the vicinity of Jalan Eunos. As the officers moved in to arrest the suspect, the 35-year-old male had put up a violent struggle and necessary force was used to subdue him. A search was conducted on him, and a total of about 328g of heroin, 122g of 'Ice', 6g of ketamine, 93 'Ecstasy' tablets, 15 Erimin-5 tablets were seized, along with cash amounting to $18,900. A total of three Singaporeans were arrested for suspected drug activities. Investigations are ongoing.Read the full story here:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 16-YEAR-OLD ARRESTED, AMONG 76 SUSPECTED DRUG OFFENDERS IN CNB ISLAND-WIDE OPERATIONIn an island-wide operation conducted by CNB from 21 to 26 Feb, an assortment of drugs including a total of about 866g of heroin, 588g of Ice, 568g of cannabis, 44g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), some ketamine, Ecstasy tablets, Erimin-5 tablets, and LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $135,000. The youngest arrested in this island-wide operation is a 16-year-old Singaporean female suspected drug abuser. Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation include Ang Mo Kio, Bedok and Bukit Batok.Investigations are ongoing.

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: CLOSE TO 7.5KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS WORTH $0.4 MILLION SEIZEDIn the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 16 Feb 2021, a total of 3,720g of heroin, 2,934g of cannabis, 813g of 'Ice', and one Erimin-5 tablet were seized during the operation that took place in multiple locations in Singapore, along with cash amounting to $9,370. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $401,000. 2 Singaporeans and 1 Malaysian were arrested for suspected drug activities. In one of the cases, CNB officer raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Edgedale Plains. The occupant, a 24-year-old Singaporean male suspected drug offender, refused CNB officers entry into the unit and attempted to evade arrest by scaling out of the window of the unit located on the 17th storey. He was subsequently pulled to safety by CNB officers. A search was conducted in the unit, and a total of six packets containing about 776g of 'Ice' and two blocks weighing about 1,914g of cannabis were seized.Investigations are ongoing.

caption: Heres an overview of Singapores drug situation in 2020.In 2020, CNB has remained steadfast in its mission towards a DrugFreeSG, while also contributing to the national COVID-19 response. Close to 100 CNB officers were involved in contact-tracing, conducting checks on persons subject to Stay-Home Notice (SHN) orders and tracking down those who did not comply, as well as in the management of dormitory operations.While the local drug situation remained largely under control, the proportion of new abusers arrested and young abusers arrested remain significant. The international drug scene remains of concern too. There is a strong push by parties with vested interests for more liberal drug policies. Global methamphetamine seizures reached a record high, and there are indications of increased trafficking in Southeast Asia. Methamphetamine has been the most commonly abused drug in Singapore since 2015. The Singapore drug control strategy is a comprehensive one that tackles both drug supply and demand through preventive drug education (PDE), tough anti-drug laws, vigorous enforcement, and effective rehabilitation and aftercare. Despite challenges from the COVID-19 pandemic, CNB conducted intensive enforcement operations dismantling 24 drug syndicates, and together with various Home Team agencies, conducted over 500 operations to intercept drugs entering Singapore. COVID-19 did not put a stop to CNBs PDE efforts as the first line of defence against drugs as well. CNB continued with our outreach by taking community engagement events, and PDE talks online, as well as offering the live-streaming of PDE skits to schools. Drug abuse exacts a high cost on abusers, their families, and ultimately society. Livelihoods are lost, relationships are destroyed, children suffer and the wider community too, because of drug-related crimes. Singapore hence adopts a harm-prevention approach to drugs, aimed at preventing the harms that drugs bring to individuals, families and society. CNB stands together with the community, and will continue to keep Singapore drug-free for our future generations.

Close to 100 CNB officers were involved in contact-tracing, conducting checks on persons subject to Stay-Home Notice (SHN) orders and tracking down those who did not comply, as well as in the management of dormitory operations. While the local drug situation remained largely under control, the proportion of new abusers arrested and young abusers arrested remain significant. The international drug scene remains of concern too. There is a strong push by parties with vested interests for more liberal drug policies. Global methamphetamine seizures reached a record high, and there are indications of increased trafficking in Southeast Asia. Methamphetamine has been the most commonly abused drug in Singapore since 2015. The Singapore drug control strategy is a comprehensive one that tackles both drug supply and demand through preventive drug education (PDE), tough anti-drug laws, vigorous enforcement, and effective rehabilitation and aftercare. Despite challenges from the COVID-19 pandemic, CNB conducted intensive enforcement operations dismantling 24 drug syndicates, and together with various Home Team agencies, conducted over 500 operations to intercept drugs entering Singapore. COVID-19 did not put a stop to CNB's PDE efforts as the first line of defence against drugs as well. CNB continued with outreach by taking community engagement events, and PDE talks online, as well as offering the live-streaming of PDE skits to schools. Drug abuse exacts a high cost on abusers, their families, and ultimately society. Livelihoods are lost, relationships are destroyed, children suffer and the wider community too, because of drug-related crimes. Singapore hence adopts a harm-prevention approach to drugs, aimed at preventing the harms that drugs bring to individuals, families and society. CNB stands together with the community, and will continue to keep Singapore drug-free for our future generations.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: OVER 1KG OF HEROIN AND CANNABIS SEIZED; 4 ARRESTED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 19 Jan, an assortment of drugs including about 1.4kg of heroin, 1kg of cannabis, 135g of Ice and some Erimin-5 and Ecstasy tablets worth close to $141,000 were seized. Four suspects were arrested. Forced entry was effected in a residential unit in the vicinity of Telok Blangah Drive, as the occupants had refused to heed the lawful orders of the CNB officers to open the door. Four Singaporean males, aged 49, 51, 56 and 61, were arrested therein. A search was conducted, and a total of ten packets and bundles containing about 1,487g of heroin, 15 packets containing about 135g of Ice, a bundle containing about 1,048g of cannabis, 10 Ecstasy tablets and 109 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered from various locations within and in the vicinity of the unit. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: 89 SUSPECTED DRUG OFFENDERS ARRESTED IN CNB ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION ; SUSPECTED DRUG OFFENDERS' 5 AND 6-YEAR-OLD CHILDREN PRESENT DURING ARREST CNBOnTheMoveIn the latest island-wide operation by CNB, a total of 89 suspected drug offenders were arrested, and a total of about 608g of heroin, 113g of 'Ice', 109g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 25g of cannabis, 11 Erimin-5 tablets, 8 'Ecstasy' tablet and 2 bottles of methadone were seized. Various drug paraphernalia and offensive weapons were also recovered. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $15,000.In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Tampines Street 21 and arrested a Singaporean couple. During the raid, the couple's children, a 5-year-old and 6-year-old, were also present in the unit. Preliminary investigations showed that the couple would abuse drugs together in their home and had last abused drugs the night before their arrest. The children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.In another case, CNB officers arrested a 22-year-old Singaporean female in the vicinity of Merpati Road, where a packet containing about 0.3g of 'Ice' found concealed in a wireless earphone casing was recovered from her. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: New Psychoactive Substances, or NPS for short, are classified as drugs that mimic the same highs that other drugs such as cocaine, meth, cannabis, or ecstasy produce. But what makes them so dangerous if they are just imitations? Stay tuned as we tackle the wanna-be drug and show just how dangerous they can be.DrugFreeSG

caption: My life while I was on drugs was one of darkness I felt hopeless with no way out. My relationship with my family deteriorated and I found it almost impossible to be or do anything good. But things are different now!Being able to pick up a skill of interest learning culinary arts at HCSA Academy, has set a direction and vision for my life. It has given me the ability to work and provide for my family while living a drug-free life, something I find very important but could never do in the past. Aloysius Wee, Graduate of HCSA Academy SingaporeansAgainstDrugs DrugFreeSG

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: NEARLY 3KG HEROIN SEIZED, TWO ARRESTED. In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 10 Dec, a total of about 2.9KG of heroin, 169 Erimin-5 tablets, 59g of cannabis, 58g of Ice and two bottles of methadone were seized. Cash amounting to $1,783, and numerous drug paraphernalia were also recovered from the operation that took place in the vicinity of Serangoon Ave 2 and Amber Road. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $230,000. Two Singaporean males, aged 55 and 63, were arrested for suspected drug activities. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: A career that makes a difference - When officers join CNB, they can expect an exciting and meaningful career. It is a job that requires our officers to put in long and irregular hours. They need to have the courage to deal with drug offenders, as well as the compassion to help individuals and families who have been affected by drugs. For those who heed this calling, it is a rewarding career. There is a sense of purpose and an everyday satisfaction knowing that you are helping to keep Singapore drug-free.Find out how you can apply for a scholarship and a meaningful career at CNB here: DrugFreeSG: Be Part Of It

caption: (3) CNBONTHEMOVE LATEST ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION (23 TO 27 NOV): SUSPECT HID IN STOREROOM BEHIND FALSE WALL IN AN ATTEMPT TO EVADE ARRESTIn another operation on 26 Nov, CNB officers raided a flat in the vicinity of Edgefield Plains, and arrested a 25-year-old Singaporean male and 24-year-old Singaporean female. A total of 32 packets containing about 631g of Ice, 3 packets containing about 113g of cannabis, and 16 Ecstasy tablets were seized. Cash amounting to $25,393 was also recovered from the unit.During the raid, CNB officers detected a storeroom behind a false wall. Officers moved in swiftly and arrested the 25-year-old Singaporean male who was hiding in the storeroom. The 25-year-old male had put up a struggle to resist arrest, and necessary force was used to subdue him.Investigations are ongoing.

caption: (2) CNBONTHEMOVE LATEST ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION (23 TO 27 NOV): TWO MOTHERS, AGED 19 AND 26, WERE USING DRUGS IN FRONT OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR-OLD AND FOUR-MONTH-OLD CHILDREN In another case on 23 Nov, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Lengkok Bahru, and arrested three suspects a 29-year-old Singaporean male, a 26-year-old Singaporean male and a 19-year-old Singaporean female. A 26-year-old Singaporean female who later returned to the same unit was also promptly arrested for suspected drug activities. A total of six packets containing about 3g of Ice were recovered in the unit, while drug paraphernalia were found on the 26-year-old Singaporean female.The 5-year-old son of the 26-year-old female, and the 4-month-old son of the 19-year-old female were also present during the arrest. Preliminary investigations showed that the 19-year-old female had brought her 4-month-old infant to visit the unit, and later abused drugs along with the 29-year-old male and 26-year-old male in the unit. Appropriate arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of both children were taken care of. Both children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.Investigations are ongoing.

In another case on 23 Nov, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Lengkok Bahru, and arrested three suspects: a 29-year-old Singaporean male, a 26-year-old Singaporean male, and a 19-year-old Singaporean female. A 26-year-old Singaporean female who later returned to the same unit was also promptly arrested for suspected drug activities. A total of six packets containing about 3g of Ice were recovered in the unit, while drug paraphernalia were found on the 26-year-old Singaporean female. The 5-year-old son of the 26-year-old female and the 4-month-old son of the 19-year-old female were also present during the arrest. Preliminary investigations showed that the 19-year-old female had brought her 4-month-old infant to visit the unit, and later abused drugs along with the 29-year-old male and 26-year-old male in the unit. Appropriate arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of both children were taken care of. Both children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: (1) CNBONTHEMOVE LATEST ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION (23 TO 27 NOV): DRUGS FOUND CONCEALED IN SKINCARE PRODUCT PACKAGING From 23 to 27 Nov, a total of 87 suspects were arrested in an island-wide operation conducted by CNB.In one of the cases on 23 Nov, CNB officers arrested a 39-year-old Singaporean male in the vicinity of Sumang Lane. 15 packets containing about 339g of Ice, seven Ecstasy tablets, and 90 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered from the suspects residential unit. Five bottles and a packet containing liquid believed to be liquid methamphetamine concealed in skincare product packaging were also seized from the unit, along with various drug paraphernalia. Investigations are ongoing. In the island-wide operation, a total of over 1.1KG of Ice, 1.4KG of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 764g of heroin, and other drugs including cannabis, ketamine, Ecstasy tablets, Erimin-5 tablets, LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and five bottles and a packet containing liquid believed to be liquid methamphetamine were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $400,000.Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation include Boon Lay, Buangkok and Aljunied.
